intro: Ranunculus brewisiae, commonly known as the Brewis's buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically features a basal rosette of serrated leaves and produces clusters of yellow or white flowers with five petals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to temperate climates with cool summers. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
